## Scottish Rite Masonic Museum & Library – Visits & Tours Overview

### **Visitor Information:**

### **Location**

[Scottish Rite Masonic Museum & Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20160424150717/https://goo.gl/maps/4KXei) (Click to view google map)

33 Marrett Road (At the intersection of Route 2A and Massachusetts Avenue)

Lexington, MA 02421

(781) 861-6559

### **Hours**

Museum is open Wednesdays through Saturdays from 10:00 am to 4:00 pm.

Library is open Wednesdays through Saturdays from 1:00 pm to 4:00 pm.

[Renting the facility](http://web.archive.org/web/20160424150717/http://www.monh.org/about/facility-rental/) for private functions will still be accommodated on any day or evening of the week.

### **Holidays**

The museum is closed on the following nationally observed holidays:

  * __

Year Year’s Day

  * __

Thanksgiving Day

  * __

Christmas Eve

  * __

Christmas Day

### **Admission**

Free admission and parking.

### **Parking**

Parking for cars and buses is available in a parking lot at the top of the hill, beyond the Museum’s entrance. Buses or cars may drop off passengers at the Museum’s entrance before proceeding on to the parking lot. Parking is free.

### **Accessibility**

The entire Museum is wheelchair accessible.

## Scottish Rite Masonic Museum & Library – Membership

**Join Our Team!!**

The Scottish Rite Masonic Museum and Library’s membership program offers a variety of opportunities for you to help us continue our proud tradition of telling the stories of our great country. By becoming a member, you support our ongoing mission: To engage and inspire, through our exhibitions, programs, and collections, a knowledge and appreciation of America’s history, heritage, culture, and traditions with a special focus on Freemasonry, and fraternalism.

The Museum is a welcoming destination for families and individuals of all ages. We present changing [exhibitions](http://web.archive.org/web/20160501085717/http://www.monh.org/exhibitions/), care for one of the finest Masonic [collections](http://web.archive.org/web/20160501085717/http://www.monh.org/collections/) in the United States, offer a research [library and archive](http://web.archive.org/web/20160501085717/http://www.monh.org/library-archives/), and present popular [events and programs](http://web.archive.org/web/20160501085717/http://www.monh.org/programs/).

Every dollar received through membership goes directly towards the Museum’s operating expenses and helps us offer free admission year round. And your membership fee is tax-deductible. Thank you for your support!

Welcome to the Scottish Rite Masonic Museum & Library. We are open from 10am-4pm Wednesday through Saturday. Free Admission & Parking.

## [The Scottish Rite Masonic Museum & Library](http://web.archive.org/web/20160501094041/http://www.monh.org/about/)

Established in 1975 by the Scottish Rite Freemasons of the Northern Masonic Jurisdiction, the Scottish Rite Masonic Museum & Library tells the story of Freemasonry and fraternalism in the context of American history. Unique in the nation, the Museum aims to be the “historical society” of American Freemasonry by collecting, preserving, interpreting and celebrating the history of fraternalism. We pay special attention to the history of the Scottish Rite and strive to serve the Masonic community.

[Click to Read More About Our Story](http://web.archive.org/web/20160501094041/http://www.monh.org/about/)

## [Our 40th Anniversary](http://web.archive.org/web/20160501094041/http://www.monh.org/Publications/Museumat40/FLASH/index.html)
